item.title: BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans”
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLÆRG released a 4 track EP, titled "Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans", through Bulgarian label MOZYK.NET.

The post BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLÆRG released a 4 track EP, titled “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans“, through Bulgarian label MOZYK.NET. It is available as a download via Bandcamp and you can also buy it on cassette tape for £7.50 GBP…

These 4 tracks show a transition out of my experiments with pure “live coded” methods and an integration with using sequencing software once again. This exciting method for creating material has run its coarse for me, so I have used it to create patterns that I then arranged in more conventional ways. The wide variety of sounds and synths continues, and the combination of all these factors makes some really interesting tracks.
Scott Wehman
Tweet

Download it

This is now available at Bandcamp.

Get it now

The post BLÆRG releases “Stridulation: The Resource Consumption of Nine Billion Humans” appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: Mark Wardale’s “Close” available for pre-order
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
“Close,” by Mark Wardale (aka Rowboat) carries us on a dramatic journey overseeing a frozen paradise. With the first track, “Byrja,” we begin by taking our first careful steps upon stairs of piano keys, then climb violin strings to board…

The post Mark Wardale’s “Close” available for pre-order appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
“Close,” by Mark Wardale (aka Rowboat) carries us on a dramatic journey overseeing a frozen paradise.
With the first track, “Byrja,” we begin by taking our first careful steps upon stairs of piano keys, then climb violin strings to board our horned ship of brass.
While riding the skies upon, “Veðráttufarsríma,” we hear our guide sing the lost story of our vessel in a voice both clear and waning.
We descend to the shores where the stoic tides are interrupted by, “Pebbles,” and surrender to the entropy of, “Óreiða.”
Our voyage ends with us wrapped in the gentle, “Sails,” that just moments before harnessed the full force of the arctic wind.
The musical craft that is the album, “Close,” gives us the perfect vantage point from which to view this world of clashing extremes and hushed tranquility. We experience swimming up waterfalls and climb mountains made of water. We build sandcastles of ash and study the light of prisms through the dark.
Wardale has crafted a narrative score that, like the voices of the unseen elves, charms and bewitches the listener and leads her to a magical world of chill beauty.

Pre-order on Bandcamp.

Mark Wardale, “Þægindi” from Daniel Tuttle on Vimeo.

The post Mark Wardale’s “Close” available for pre-order appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: “Excession” by Metria available on vinyl
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
“Excession” by Metria is now available on vinyl via Void Tactical Media. Excession VTCL004 by Metria I remember walking across to Division Street sometime around 2008, hearing this otherworldly howling echo across the Eastern Market. When I came in the…

The post “Excession” by Metria available on vinyl appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
“Excession” by Metria is now available on vinyl via Void Tactical Media.

I remember walking across to Division Street sometime around 2008, hearing this otherworldly howling echo across the Eastern Market. When I came in the door, it was David Cole, Metria, piloting his Nord Lead to sing the songs of the post-industrial era. In the years since then, I’ve seen Metria perform fewer times that I would have expected, but it has often been a similar story: an initial disorientation, an unexpected exposure to a sound, following by the recognition that here is one of our own, speaking the story of our times in Detroit through electronics and noise.

Void Tactical Media 004 captures one of those moments, this time from our party Excession in 2011, organized primarily by Key. Landing at North End Studios on a cold December night, we had pro sound from Jim Gibbons but no heat, just people showing up in a raw Detroit space to hear beats and noise. Metria played as an opener that night, and played short – something like 20 minutes. But when the set ended, Dave had taken us somewhere that we hadn’t expected just yet. A tempo-warping, hard broken beat industrial build was answered with yelling and cheers at the early hour of 10:30pm. You might even say the rest of the party was unnecessary.

For several years we would reminisce about that set, but then a funny thing happened: our friend Andy showed up with recordings of the event, which we’d completely forgotten about. Turns out Metria’s set fits almost perfectly onto 12” vinyl. Key revisited her original flier art to work it into an amazing jacket design. Final 2 color silk screening on matte black paper by Angie Coe at Ocelot Print Shop in Detroit.

Now grab this piece of history, and support Void Tactical’s core sound and concepts!

The post “Excession” by Metria available on vinyl appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: Score by Mark Wardale
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
Row Boat’s Mark Wardale provided the beautiful music for this short film. This is a short film about the life and culture behind the scenes of Cape Town City FC. It is a story about a group of people labelled…

The post Score by Mark Wardale appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Row Boat’s Mark Wardale provided the beautiful music for this short film.

This is a short film about the life and culture behind the scenes of Cape Town City FC. It is a story about a group of people labelled “misfits” by the press, who rallied against the odds through sheer hard work and belief to become champions, and capture the hearts and minds of people all over South Africa.

Cape Town City FC from Fell & Co on Vimeo.

The post Score by Mark Wardale appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
BLÆRG released The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest Friday, February 24th. Another full exploration of modular synthesis and intricate beat work, this album continues to push the quality bar higher and higher. Digital download available from Bandcamp. The Stolid…

The post BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
BLÆRG released The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest Friday, February 24th. Another full exploration of modular synthesis and intricate beat work, this album continues to push the quality bar higher and higher. Digital download available from Bandcamp.

This release is a name your own price release, but consider throwing money at:

In response to recent actions from the current U.S. presidential administration attempting to stoke fear and hatred against Muslims, and particularly to deny entry to the U.S. from select Muslim-majority countries, all revenue from this release will go to CAIRMN (the Minnesota chapter of the Council on American–Islamic Relations). This organization is working to build coalitions between Muslims in the U.S. and their communities (specifically in Minnesota), increase understanding of Islam, and protect civil liberties. They have the full support of the artist and the label.

The post BLÆRG releases The Stolid Membrane on Immigrant Breast Nest appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.

item.title: Welcome in violet, new single streaming at Echoes and Dust
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tuttle
item.description:
Bottle Imp wants to welcome in violet to the roster. We’re going to release their new album, titled “amber”, on October 21st. The title single will be available widely this Friday. Today and tomorrow you can listen to the single…

The post Welcome in violet, new single streaming at Echoes and Dust appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Bottle Imp wants to welcome in violet to the roster. We’re going to release their new album, titled “amber”, on October 21st. The title single will be available widely this Friday.

Today and tomorrow you can listen to the single exclusively at Echoes and Dust. Head over and take a listen!

‘Amber’, the lead single from the album, is a sharp plunge down a dissociative rabbit-hole. Absent of light and minimal in vocals, the song is both familiar with its industrial techno influence yet far from resembling anything clearly. It shows in violet taking a new turn for the more direct and driven, choosing to engage the listener head-on with a thump to the chest. Never quite pop nor experimental, rock nor electronic, but somewhere in between. ‘Amber’ sets the tone for a record that leaves no stone unturned as it explores the ideas of self, relationship, sound, structure, space, time, life and death.

The post Welcome in violet, new single streaming at Echoes and Dust appeared first on Bottle Imp Productions.
